page.title: 12M1 MOTORWAY MILTON KEYNES
page.content: The M1 is a piece of road people use to get somewhere fast.There are 3 lanes on each side and two hard shoulders for breakdowns and police cars. The middle area is called the central reservation and it has a crash barrier to stop cars going onto the other carriageway. No pedestrians are allowed because the cars go too fast. On Friday July 5th., 1985, traffic was counted between 10.00 a.m. and 10.15 a.m. These are the results: there were 268 cars, 151 lorries, 9 coaches and 1 motor bike using the northbound carriageway i.e. 429 vehicles. On the southbound carriageway there were 238 cars, 158 lorries, 16 coaches and 1 motor bike i.e.413 vehicles.
